results.title: The Seventh continent (Anamorphic)
results.creator_credit: Dusan Vukoric, Fimove Studio Koliba and Jadran Film (Zagreb)
results.brief_description: Two runaway children discover a magical island, the Seventh Continent. Soon, children of various nationalities and races come to the Seventh Continent where they create a new world of fun and fantasy far from adults. A Yugoslav-Czech co-production. In cinemascope - requires an anamorphic lense.

results.title: The Sediment problem
results.creator_credit: Gordon Thomas and University of Strathclyde
results.brief_description: An examination of the detrimental depletion of soil resources from the land by natural means and by man’s intervention. Shot at a number of locations in the Scottish Highlands and the Clyde Valley. Intended for students of civil engineering.

results.title: The Secret Files of J. Edgar Hoover
results.creator_credit: Jerry Kupcinet, Joseph Honig and Western International Syndication
results.brief_description: All personalities whose actions shaped 20th century America, and all unwitting stars in an infamous production are now revealed for the very first time in “The secret files of J. Edgar Hoover”. Power, fear, influence - serving under 8 presidents, he was accountable to none. Politicians came and went, but Hoover remained, a public servant who died a millionaire.
results.title_for_label: The Secret Files of J. Edgar Hoover

results.title: The Seat = Fotel
results.brief_description: A witty and telling view of the patterns of power using animated cartoon techniques. From above we watch a general meeting when a new committee member has to be elected. Each nominee is stopped from taking his place by other jealous workers, until one candidate is more resourceful than the others.

results.title: The Scribe
results.creator_credit: John Sebert, Ann Neely-Ray, Kenneth Neely-Ray and Film-Tele
results.brief_description: A newspaper editor decides to do a story on industrial safety and sends a reporter to a large construction site. But the reporter is Buster Keaton whose antics at the building cause some consternatin. However, the sixteen basic safety rules which apply on large construction sites are effectively and humourously illustrated. This is Buster Keaton’s final film.

results.title: The School nurse; Health examination of the school entrant
results.brief_description: Introduced by Debra Lawrance. Part 1 (7 min) provides an explanation of the overall role of the school nurse. Depicts the examination of the new school entrant, liaision between the school and parents and other community bodies. Part 2 (21min) illustrates the work done by the school nurse in assessing the health and well-being of new school entrants. Medical terminology is used in this verbally dense program.

results.title: The Rumour of true things
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, black and white and colour and audio
results.brief_description:
Most of the moving images produced for science, industry, commerce and medicine are seen only by specialised audiences and are then discarded soon after they are made.

The Rumour of True Things’ is constructed entirely from such moving images ephemera, including computer games, weapons testing, production lines, monitoring and marriage agency tapes.The Rumour of True Things’ is a remarkable anthropological portrait of a technologically-based society obsessed with imaging itself.

Taken from PROOF exhibition November 2004
